headline: Grilled Salmon
description: Grilled salmon with a simple soy sauce and brown sugar marinade. The sweet-salty flavors in the marinade complement the rich salmon fillets perfectly.

video.description: Watch this video, and grill your best salmon ever. A simple soy sauce and brown sugar marinade, with hints of lemon and garlic, are the perfect salty-sweet complement to rich salmon fillets. Fresh vegetables and rice are the perfect side dishes.
video.name: How to Grill Salmon Perfectly Every Time | Get Cookin‚Äô | Allrecipes.com

name: Grilled Salmon

recipeInstructions.text: Season salmon fillets with lemon pepper, garlic powder, and salt.

Stir soy sauce, brown sugar, water, and vegetable oil together in a small bowl until sugar is dissolved. Place fish in a large resealable plastic bag; add soy sauce mixture, seal, and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
Place salmon on the preheated grill, and discard marinade. Cook salmon until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 6 to 8 minutes per side.

review.reviewBody: This was excellent! My family loved it and asked to put it into the monthly rotation!

This was so good! My niece who doesn't really like salmon could not stop eating it. Simple ingredients but such a big flavor, just perfect. I have also baked the salmon at 400 covered with foil for 15 min so easy ao good.

Used olive oil instead of vegetable. Added about 2 tsp of minced ginger and 2 tsp of chili garlic sauce to the marinade. Only used about half the brown sugar. Omitted the salt as the soy has plenty. I seldom marinade the full time, but do make slashes in the salmon so that it soaks into it better. I broil for about 10 minutes, serve with Israeli couscous and steamed vegetables.
Unique flavor that everyone loves. Huge hit!

Great recipe üòç The way I normally make this dish at my restaurant is that I tend to add slightly less brown sugar but apart from that it's perfect üôå üëâ Feel free to check out my recipes that I use at my restaurant by visiting my profile ü§ó Enjoy!

This is my "go to" Salmon recipe. I am not a big Salmon fan but I have made this recipe numerous times and it is by far my favorite way to eat Salmon. It is simple to make and so delicious. I follow the recipe exactly and my husband and I are never disappointed. So yummy!

This was really good! We had a torrential downpour over the dinner hours so I too had to use the oven for this. I preheated the oven to 450 with the sheet pan inside. Once the oven reached temp I placed the salmon skin size down on the pan. Placed it back in the oven and baked for 12 minutes. Salmon was flaky and the skin was crisp. Yummy marinade.
Delicious
Extremely easy. Fantastic flavor.
Delicious and so easy. Made it as shown with no changes. Will definitely make it again.
Awesome

Easy & excellent! My 4 yr. old loves it too. I tend to like sauce so I take make the marinade enough for 6 servings (instead of 4) if I have a pound of salmon. After I put the salmon in the oven, I take the leftover marinade and put it into a frying pan and let it simmer for the length of time the salmon is in the oven. It slowly thickens & makes a super yummy sauce to top on the fish.
It is a great recipe. Watching the video really gave me some helpful hints. It was delicious.
Great marinade for salmon!
Cooked on nonstick foil on the grill, otherwise no change to recipe. So good üòç
Super easy for the first timer grilling salmon! We loved it!
Tasty .. Will make again. I cooked it over open fire . Real good
Love it! Best salmon recipe ever!
I use this recipe every time I grill salmon since trying it a few years ago. The whole family loves it.
Have made this recipe several times and it‚Äôs always a hit! Every person that eats it always asks for the recipe. Thanks a million.
I made it this, but I took another suggestion and out these in foil and in the oven for 15 minutes on 400 instead of grilling. Tasted great!
I loved it. Easy to prepare and packed full of flavor. So good that even my 2 yr nephew loved it.
No changes, loved it! Made it with a side of asparagus and rice pilaf.
Best I have ever had. I added a splash of bourbon to the marinade and poached it in the foil packet as suggested by one of the reviewers. Poaching is the only way to go. 425 oven for 15 min. perfect.
Wonderful recipe and so simple!
Easy recipe. Put the non-skin side down first. Then flip after 6-8 minutes so the skin side is down.
Easy and delicious.

My wife found this recipe. We use the recipe once a week. It is the best I personally have ever had. When guess come over that like salmon this is it!!!! I get a lot of ‚Äúwow‚Äôs and ‚ÄúAmazings‚Äù. Makes me feel like I‚Äôm a top chef. But it‚Äôs this recipe.

My 5 year old who doesn‚Äôt like salmon liked this and cleaned her plate! I followed the recipe except for only marinating for 10 minutes due to time and saut√©ing instead of grilling‚Ä¶it was delicious! A new staple of mine for taste, time and ease of cooking :)
This is my goto recipe for grilling salmon.
Really enjoyed it. Will cut the Brown Sugar in half next time I make it.
This was excellent just the way it was. I probably won't use as much brown sugar next time, but that's just personal preference. This a is a really solid recipe that's super easy to make.
Great marinade. Tastes as good as what you would get at a restaurant.
Absolutely delicious! Best salmon I‚Äôve ever made!!
Very easy and delicious!
Good flavor, I like the subtle soy sauce coming thru.

This salmon was by far the most delicious I‚Äôve ever had (and I eat A LOT of salmon)! Usually I bake it, but since we‚Äôve reached summer I thought I‚Äôd be adventurous and try my hand at grilling. I looked up a couple different recipes and ultimately decided on this because I had everything on hand.
this is my got for my family. my kids are always asking me to make it. to bad salmon is so costly. I also use this receipt on all kids of different fish.
Needs more time on the grill. A little raw on the inside.

Every time I make this, the entire slab is salmon gets demolished. I have been using this recipe for several years now and have converted non-salmon eaters into salmon eaters! Such a wonderful recipe!
Perfect marination..

Our favorite preparation for salmon. Have made several times for guests and family. Never fails to be a hit. Forgot to season w the salt, lemon pepper and garlic powder once instead I mixed all
Ingredients together. Was going to discard and start over. Happy I didn‚Äôt. Still came out great.
This was delicious. My wife, who does not like salmon liked it. I did let it marinate all day in the fridge!

This was a perfect. Marinated several hours 2 salmon filets. Seared 2 min each side and made foil pouch to finish 5 min in preheated 400 degree oven. Served with cubed sweet potato, beets and sweet onion Roasted
Awesome. This was so good. My husband and I had not had grilled Salmon before. So good. Will definitely fix it again.
Better than any salmon I have had in any restaurant... and I LOVE grilled salmon. Also easy!
We absolutely love this recipe. I do a large slab of salmon and we have for several meals! Hot with the fixings or cold as a sandwich or on a salad. Alwaysso tasty!
Easy and very tasty, loved it!
This is my go to recipe for salmon. My kids and I absolutely love it. Never any leftovers unfortunately.

Loved this recipe! It helps to rub oil on the grill before lighting it, I'm kind of a newbie to grilling fish so I was suprised by how much it stuck, and by how much stayed together and was delicious. I'm sure marinating for longer is even better, I only let it sit in the marinade for about 20-30 minutes and it was delicious.
Very simple, and oh so good! I used some orange juice in place of some of the water. Next time, I will grill it a little less long. This is definitely a keeper!

I cooked the salmon fillet on the BBQ using non direct heat. On high heat, the salmon picked up flavor from the smoke. This was one of the best Salmon dishes I‚Äôve had. I did not alter the recipe. Thanks!
So delicious and so easy to make.
It was ok. Nothing to write home about and not enough flavor. Not sure why it includes water in the marinade.
Loved it and I didn't change anything except I put in oven for 12 minutes @ 450 along with broccoli...both turned out perfect! Thanks for the recipe
A new salmon recipe we are adding to the rotation. Very good and I liked another's tip for baking it in the oven with foil.

I had 1 small filet of salmon and wanted to bake it in the oven with my Brussels sprouts so went on the search for a simple recipe. Came across this and so glad I did. I divided the ingredients by 3, following everything except I didn‚Äôt have time to marinate the salmon. I saw the review about poaching, so I put the salmon in a piece of foil and drizzled half the marinade on top. Folded the top of foil, leaving some air space and baked at 400¬∞ for 15 minutes. Oh my! So good! Next time I will marinate the salmon a couple hours, as suggested, and grill it. But poaching will be my winter cooking method from now on.

I have made this recipe for 4-5 years now and follow the directions exactly. It is my son's favorite recipe. It is also one of my go-to recipes for company. Everyone always loves it. Make sure to get skin-on fillet so that the salmon does not get dried out on the grill. I leave the salmon skin down for 7-8 minutes then flip for another 5-6 minutes. Watch the thinner part of the fillet so it does not over cook. Thank you for this easy, delicious recipe!
Fantastic, left the sauce on and did it under the broiler. Definitely a keeper. Substituted juice from one lime and two sliced garlic cloves, for the powdered spices.
It was very easy to make, yet very tasty.

Yummy and wonderful!!! All I can say about this grilled salmon recipe. It is definitely one of my favorites. Very easy to cook and it is not too dry with very distinct flavor. I definitely recommend you to try this one.
Turned out great for me! Finally a recipe that I like at home with salmon!
Great! My family enjoyed every bite.
This is the only way we eat salmon. My husband is not a huge fan of fish, but he will eat this. Don‚Äôt change a thing; it is perfect the way it is!! Delicious!!!
outstanding. I grilled on a bed of lemons

I cooked this salmon under the broiler since it's so cold outside and served it with whole grain rice and sauteed green & red peppers, mushrooms and fresh spinach. DELICIOUS! I used the recipe as shown and made no changes. Will be using this recipe everytime I make salmon now. Really really good!

Fantastic! I‚Äôve stayed away from salmon for awhile because I‚Äôve never been able to make it so that my kids will eat it. Well not so today‚Äînothing but praises for this dish. Flavorful and uncomplicated.
Nice and rich flavor
This tastes amazing!
In
Love, Love, Love this easy marinade. Wrapped in foil with some of the marinade and baked,
Love this recipe. This has become our go-to recipe for grilled salmon!

DELICIOUS! I didn‚Äôt grill the fish as instructed but rather baked the fish with the marinade in the oven at 375 covered for 30 minutes then uncovered for 15 minutes. I also added about 1/4 tbsp of teriyaki sauce. My family LOVES it. My boyfriend and kids aren‚Äôt used to fresh fish, and are getting used to it. This recipe seems to be the best so far (that they didn‚Äôt complain about after).
I've been using this salmon marinade for close to 20 years. We call it "awesome salmon marinade". It really is that good. The perfect mix of salty and sweet.
Such a yummy sauce, I loved this so much and didn‚Äôt change the recipe but added some of the suggestions
It was really yummy! the family loved it! I have another salmon recipe they like a little more,but this one is a nice change!

My family and I are not fans of salmon but we are trying. I made this recipe for dinner tonight and my husband, son and I loved it. It‚Äôs definitely a keeper. The only change was that I cooked it in a fry pan with a little cooking spray. Fantastic!!!

DELICIOUS!!! Came out spectacular. Made it exactly as instructed and wouldn‚Äôt tweak anything about it. First time ever I don‚Äôt have ANY leftovers. Unfortunately because I‚Äôd love a second helping lol
I used steel head trout. Everything the same. To grill put flesh down on grill cook first and then flip it. The fish stays together better.
This simple recipe is one of my absolute favorites, I make it all the time!
Delicious salmon! My son doesn't like seafood, but this recipe changed his mind.

Amazing! I'll definitely be keeping this as a go-to recipe. It's slightly sweet and slightly tangy.

DO NOT overcook this fish. And on a grill it cooks up within 5-10 minutes
Delicious!
Best way I've had salmon as of yet

This is 1 of 2 recipes I have permanently stored in my cellphone. Im a 42 yr old Dad, and both my wife and daughter think that im sometype of magic chef because i make this dish. Its amazing, its easy, its super fast. It tastes like salted fish candy. There is a good reason why this gets 5 of 5 stars. To make salmon any other way is just waste of good fish. Sometimes i throw mine on stovetop and sear it in pan with a very lil bit oil, just to make it a lil crunchy on outside.
Great recipe! I did marinate this for around six hours before grilling. Served with Jasmine rice and green beans. Thanks I will be making this again.
Amazing, grill it face down as recommended, definitely a keeper!

This not my first time using this recipe,as a matter of fact, this is the only recipe I used when grilling salmon. I do sprinkle Cajun seasoning while grilling since my boys like spicy food. It is loved by my family.

I loved it. I didn't have any lemon pepper so I used freshly ground pepper then, before I grilled the salmon, I grated lemon zest over the salmon. That worked very well. I am always looking for good, easy salmon recipes. This is a good one. I used a grilling mat with my gas grill and followed the skin side up/ skin side down instructions. It worked very well with the grill set to low. Thanks!
Fabulous recipe! I made it for a large family gathering and everyone loved it! I didn‚Äôt change anything!

Totally awesome marinade! I added a little minced garlic and ginger to my marinade, it added depth to it. You can‚Äôt go wrong with this one. I‚Äôve made it in my Ninja Foodi on the air crisp mode...PERFECT!!!
Really good salmon recipe!
Easy and delicious
This is my go to recipe for salmon. The only difference I made. Instead of lemon pepper I use ginger powder. Sometimes I only marinade for 45 min, and it still turns out beautifully.
I didn't have any lemon pepper, but it was delicious. It ended up marinating in the fridge overnight, so that might have made it a bit sweeter than intended. Will make it again.
good

Didn't have lemon pepper on hand, so I used 1/3 cup lemon juice and 1/4 tsp pepper instead. That was the only change. Everything else was exact. Baked in preheated oven at 450¬∞F for 15 mins on parchment paper. Omg, even the skin came out amazing and I usually throw it out despite it being the healthiest part. Absolutely Phenomenal!!!

I chose sockeye salmon rather than Atlantic salmon for this recipe and marinated it for 3 hours. I added some fresh lemon juice to the recipe for acidity and zing. It was delicious--best salmon I've ever had!!!
5 stars for me, less sugar to be 5 stars for him; added ginger and lemon juice to marinade. Took advice and baked on 425 in foil pockets. Skin on so I added a couple minutes.
